content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-101-11-A
|Item_parent=Facial paralysis
|Item_parent_short=Facial paralysis
|Rank=A
|Intitle=Clinical iconography of a typical example of unilateral PFP
|Description=Visualise facial asymmetry to mimicry with immobility of superior and inferior territory
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=11}}
Please refer to the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available.

properties.question: In the clinical iconography of unilateral Paralysis of Facial Nerve (PFP), which of the following best describes the observed facial asymmetry?
properties.option_a: Mobility of both superior and inferior facial regions
properties.option_b: Immobility of the superior facial region with normal movement in the inferior region
properties.option_c: Immobility of both superior and inferior facial regions
properties.option_d: Mobility of the inferior facial region with slight immobility in the superior region
